(4, 1, 1): Quantitative reasoning, verbal reasoning, integrated reasoning, analytical writing.
(5, 1, 1): Admissions in graduate management programs of business schools.
(8, 1, 1): Quantitative section: 6-51, in 1 point increments, ,  Verbal section: 6-51, in 1 point increments, ,  Integrated reasoning section: 1 to 8, in 1 point increments, ,  Analytical writing assessment: 0.0 to 6.0, in 0.5 point increments. ,  Total score (from verbal and quantitative sections only): 200 to 800.
(14, 1, 1): No official prerequisite. Intended for those interested in graduate management education. Fluency in English assumed.
(16, 1, 1): More than 7,000 programs at approximately 2,300 graduate business schools around the world accept the GMAT exam.
